thread.title: Internet, a smart choice in Khammam

author: Deccan
title: Internet, a smart choice in Khammam
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 18, 2015, 00.44 am Service providers have laid optic fibre lines on the outskirts of Khammam to cover nearby villages. Khammam: The extensive use of smartphones has led to an exponential increase in the number of Internet connections in Khammam city. People using smartphones are finding it easy to make calls through WhatsApp, Hangouts and Viber as it costs less, which is possible with an Internet connection.
Families with children pursuing engineering courses and those who are abroad are going for Internet connections to talk to their kin staying in other countries via Skype. Further, all households with Internet connection have routers as the Wi-Fi signals would serve the needs of all the family members.
There are half-a-dozen engineering colleges and one medical college near Khammam with a good number of students studying in them. K. Sudheer, an engineering student, said, “Wi-Fi will reduce the amount of cellphone bill. A majority of my friends communicate through WhatsApp and Viber as they are free, if we have Wi-Fi signals.”
Not just smartphones, laptops and desktops also can also be operated with the Wi-Fi signals. Wi-Fi signals from a router would cover 100 tm radius. The Internet connections which were at 9,600 till last year, jumped to 14,000 this year. Various service provi-ders like Hi-Reach, Velocity, Viber, Usha-sree Internet, Vega Broadband, Excell, Will Broadband and Jayasree, apart from the giants like BSNL broadband, Airtel, Tata and Reliance cater to the needs of people in Khammam.
Hi-Reach representative G. Tirupati Naik said they have been receiving 25-30 applications everyday seeking Internet connection. “We started providing Inter-net two years ago and the number was very small then. Now, we have 6,000 customers,” he said.
The service providers have laid optic fibre lines on the outskirts of the city, covering some villages nearby as well.
